body:
Could you check to see exactly what that PC is pointing to?

On Wed, Sep 23, 2015 at 2:23 PM, Brent Rowland <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Here is my panic log:
>
> fatal error: unexpected signal during runtime execution
> [signal 0xb code=0x1 addr=0x10 pc=0x403750]
>
> runtime stack:
> runtime.throw(0x8188e0, 0x2a)
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/panic.go:527 +0x90
> runtime.sigpanic()
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/sigpanic_unix.go:12 +0x5a
>
> goroutine 66 [syscall, locked to thread]:
> runtime.cgocall(0x402e60, 0xc88e779aa8, 0x0)

>     ??:0 +0x36 fp=0xc88e779aa8 sp=0xc88e779a70github.com/rowland/go-fb.newCursor(0xc8204963c0, 0xc8204ac000, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /home/brent/src/github.com/rowland/go-fb/cursor.go:50 +0x14e fp=0xc88e779b18 sp=0xc88e779aa8github.com/rowland/go-fb.(*Connection).Execute(0xc8204963c0, 0xc88e440800, 0x6d6, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x1e, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /home/brent/src/github.com/rowland/go-fb/connection.go:150 +0x39 fp=0xc88e779b68 sp=0xc88e779b18
> dev.go/projects/talent-search/talent.(*Search).tryFailedScores(0xc82000a160)
>     /home/brent/src/dev.go/projects/talent-search/talent/search.go:547 +0x4ed fp=0xc88e779d58 sp=0xc88e779b68
> dev.go/projects/talent-search/talent.(*Search).JournalMonitor(0xc82000a160, 0xcbf4abf)
>     /home/brent/src/dev.go/projects/talent-search/talent/search.go:318 +0x34a fp=0xc88e779f90 sp=0xc88e779d58
> runtime.goexit()
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1696 +0x1 fp=0xc88e779f98 sp=0xc88e779f90
> created by main.main
>     /home/brent/src/dev.go/projects/talent-search/talent-search.go:180 +0xa48
>
> goroutine 1 [select]:
> main.ProcessIncomingMessages(0xc82049a0c0)
>     /home/brent/src/dev.go/projects/talent-search/talent-search.go:219 +0xab6
> main.main()
>     /home/brent/src/dev.go/projects/talent-search/talent-search.go:199 +0x9bc
>
> goroutine 17 [syscall, 17 minutes, locked to thread]:
> runtime.goexit()
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1696 +0x1
>
> goroutine 5 [syscall, 17 minutes]:
> os/signal.loop()
>     /usr/local/go/src/os/signal/signal_unix.go:22 +0x18
> created by os/signal.init.1
>     /usr/local/go/src/os/signal/signal_unix.go:28 +0x37
>
> goroutine 67 [IO wait, 8 minutes]:
> net.runtime_pollWait(0x7f9a3f0ce840, 0x72, 0xc820010190)
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/netpoll.go:157 +0x60
> net.(*pollDesc).Wait(0xc88e794060, 0x72, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/fd_poll_runtime.go:73 +0x3a
> net.(*pollDesc).WaitRead(0xc88e794060, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/fd_poll_runtime.go:78 +0x36
> net.(*netFD).accept(0xc88e794000, 0x0, 0x7f9a3c884080, 0xc88e79a000)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/fd_unix.go:408 +0x27c
> net.(*TCPListener).AcceptTCP(0xc88e798000, 0xc88e781de0, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/tcpsock_posix.go:254 +0x4d
> net/http.tcpKeepAliveListener.Accept(0xc88e798000, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:2135 +0x41
> net/http.(*Server).Serve(0xc88e788000, 0x7f9a0420a0b0, 0xc88e798000, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:1887 +0xb3
> net/http.(*Server).ListenAndServe(0xc88e788000, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:1877 +0x136
> net/http.ListenAndServe(0x7a9d30, 0x5, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)

>

> net.runtime_pollWait(0x7f9a3f0ce900, 0x72, 0xc820010190)
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/netpoll.go:157 +0x60
> net.(*pollDesc).Wait(0xc8204a00d0, 0x72, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/fd_poll_runtime.go:73 +0x3a
> net.(*pollDesc).WaitRead(0xc8204a00d0, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/fd_poll_runtime.go:78 +0x36
> net.(*netFD).readFrom(0xc8204a0070, 0xc88e77aea8, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x7f9a3f0c9050, 0xc820010190)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/fd_unix.go:259 +0x2a5
> net.(*UDPConn).ReadFromUDP(0xc8204a4000, 0xc88e77aea8, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0xc88e572960, 0x18, 0x0, 0x0)
>     /usr/local/go/src/net/udpsock_posix.go:61 +0x117
> dev.go/utilities/brokerclient.(*BrokerClient).listener(0xc8204a2050, 0xc82049a0c0, 0xc82049a000)
>     /home/brent/src/dev.go/utilities/brokerclient/brokerclient.go:88 +0x135
> created by dev.go/utilities/brokerclient.(*BrokerClient).StartListener
>     /home/brent/src/dev.go/utilities/brokerclient/brokerclient.go:74 +0x9a
>
> goroutine 69 [select, 8 minutes, locked to thread]:
> runtime.gopark(0x843db8, 0xc8204f5728, 0x7ad950, 0x6, 0x432118, 0x2)
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/proc.go:185 +0x163
> runtime.selectgoImpl(0xc8204f5728, 0x0, 0x18)
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/select.go:392 +0xa64
> runtime.selectgo(0xc8204f5728)
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/select.go:212 +0x12
> runtime.ensureSigM.func1()
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/signal1_unix.go:227 +0x353
> runtime.goexit()
>     /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1696 +0x1
>
> Signal 11 is segfault, of course, and the C code is fairly simple:
>
> XSQLDA* sqlda_alloc(long cols)
> {
>     XSQLDA *sqlda;
>
>     sqlda = (XSQLDA*)malloc(XSQLDA_LENGTH(cols));
>     sqlda->version = SQLDA_VERSION1;
>     sqlda->sqln = cols;
>     sqlda->sqld = 0;
>     return sqlda;
> }
>
> There *is* a malloc and if it fails, that would certainly trigger a
> segfault. Hard to say what would be better than a panic if malloc is
> failing. Haven't tested for that since DOS days. Again, this has only been
> a problem in Go 1.5 and 1.5.1.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/12233#issuecomment-142687601>.
>
